question: The Dominican Republic forms part of which archipelago?
explanation: The Dominican Republic is a country located in the West Indies region in the Hispaniola Islands of the Greater Antilles Archipelago. The Atlantic Ocean and the Caribbean Sea form the coastline of the Dominican Republic to the north and south respectively. The Dominican Republic shares Hispaniola Island with Haiti to the east. The Bahamas and the Turks and Caicos Islands lie to the north and north-west. Puerto Rico which is separated by the Mona Passage lies to the east of the Dominican Republic. Santo Domingo is the capital of the Dominican Republic. Spanish is the official language of the Dominican Republic.
